title: `rustc` cannot relate bound region

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust struct Inner<'a> { a: &'a [u8] } fn yes(vec:&Vec) -> bool{ true } fn other<'a>(prameter:&Vec>>) { prameter.iter().filter(yes); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0-nightly (52372f9c7 2023-01-21) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler\rustc_infer\src\infer\region_constraints\mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 1, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:11 ~ mid2json[14bb]::ice::yes::'_#1), '_) }) <= '_#5r ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/52372f9c71d8ade4cb815524f179119656f0aa2e\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:987:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff9fd459d02 - ::fmt::hcb4c63debb70c0b2 1: 0x7ff9fd49574b -
